company.name: BitGo
company.description:
Many believe that BitGo is the most secure and intelligent way to trade digital assets 
and that no one is better positioned to serve institutional investors in this space. 
Today, BitGo has over $64 billion of assets under custody, second only to Coinbase! 

It’s that special, fast growing company that you'll have wanted to be a part 
of - Goldman Sachs, Craft Ventures, Digital Currency Group, DRW, Galaxy Digital Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, 
and Valor Equity Partners (who are all backers) seem to agree! Their strategic investment not only validates 
BitGo’s unique positioning to disrupt legacy financial systems, but also the market opportunity.

jobAd.title: Staff Software Engineer (Backend), Blockchain OS
jobAd.description: BitGo is looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join our Blockchain OS team and help us build resilient, robust services and are responsible for working on critical projects with limited or no supervision. This role can be worked remotely so long as your home base is in North America.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Collaborate closely with all engineering teams and product managers to ensure consistency in understanding of technical requirements and overall work quality
- Design and build strong, resilient, and robust APIs to power our application services
- Have mastery in core technologies and tools, understand all phases of the company software development life cycle, and demonstrate initiative and integrity in all aspects of work. 
- Demonstrate good analytical skills, have a basic understanding of overall company organization, as well as a strong understanding of business partner relationships and operations.
- Develop and coordinate software unit testing and system testing and validation procedures, and documentation
- Coordinate software deployments and monitor applications to ensure specifications are met 
- Own functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility from inception to deployment and customer integration
- Expose and document functionality to the UI, third-party developers, and our internal and external tooling
- Provide mentorship to your peers in the broader engineering team through code reviews and education on best practices
- Capable of building proofs-of-concept(POC) with fellow engineers and/or stakeholders while ensuring the current milestones are met
- Monitor and troubleshoot production software issues and provide solutions while being a part of on-call rotation
- Follow legal policies as directed
jobAd.requirements:
- Minimum of 8 years in building enterprise level applications on a cross-functional Agile Software Development team
- Strong development experience with any of the JVM languages, preferably Java or Kotlin
- Experience building web services, preferably using REST
- Development experience building microservices in Spring
- Experience with Asynchronous messaging technologies such as Apache Kafka, JMS  or RabbitMQ
- Experience working with public cloud development, preferably AWS
- Strong relational database experience 
- Experience in an agile development environment with continuous integration and continuous delivery, using tools such as Git, Docker and Kubernetes
- Experience with production troubleshooting and analysis using log/debugging tools such as Grafana, ELK, Splunk or New Relic
- Highly proficient in understanding new technologies accomplishing projects goals successfully
jobAd.preferred:
- Experience with NoSQL databases, preferably Mongo
- Experience with Web technologies e.g. JavaScript / TypeScript / React / Node
- Experience with functional programming languages/paradigms
- Proficiency with IDE-based development, especially in IntelliJ or Eclipse
- Understanding of and strong interest in cryptocurrencies and blockchain
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment

jobAd.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend), Bitcoin
jobAd.description:
BitGo is looking for a **Sr. Software Engineer (Backend)** who will join our Bitcoin Team. BitGo processes a significant amount
of cryptocurrency transactions so our applications need to be fast, accurate, scalable and secure.
Our integrated platforms interact with a number of exchanges, agencies, and governments around
the world, and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them.

We are looking for teammates who share and practice our values of open communication, collaboration, accountability, and craftsmanship, 
and who feel passionate about  our mission to deliver trust in digital assets.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Enhance our multi-signature Bitcoin wallets with the latest and greatest features that Bitcoin has to offer, at the scale of billions of dollars per month
- Own functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility from inception to deployment and customer integration
- Improve, extend and maintain existing software which integrates with the Bitcoin blockchain and bitcoind fullnode
- Expose and document API features for usage by the customer facing BitGo wallet UI, third-party developers, and our internal and external tooling
- Collaborate closely with all engineering teams to ensure consistency in understanding of technical requirements and overall work quality
- Provide mentorship to your peers in the broader engineering team through sharing your knowledge and passion for Bitcoin
jobAd.requirements:
- Strong understanding of fundamental Bitcoin blockchain mechanics, including bitcoind RPC commands, P2SH scripts and multisig opcodes, Segwit (wrapped and native), CPFP, RBF, UTXO selection and BIP 32 key derivation
- Familiarity with emerging Bitcoin features, such as BIP 340/341/342/350 (Taproot/Schnorr/bech32m) and Lightning
- Passion for enabling cutting-edge Bitcoin features at scale
- At least 5 years of back-end or protocol-level software development experience
- Believes in testing twice (or more), and shipping once
- Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
jobAd.preferred:
- Active or previous contributor to Bitcoin Core, Lightning or other Bitcoin-related open source software
- Ability to program and debug Node.JS, JavaScript, Typescript, or Java
- Strong experience with RESTful API design
- Comfortable with git and Github-based code review
- Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment

jobAd.title: Engineering Manager, DeFi
jobAd.description:
BitGo is looking for an **Engineering Manager** who will lead our DeFi team in the United States to help us integrate and explore the latest technologies in the DeFi space.

We are looking for teammates who share and practice our values: open communication, collaboration, taking ownership, and a high level of craftsmanship.
We are looking for coworkers who share our vision and mission: deliver trust in digital assets.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Collaborate with management, product teams, and other key stakeholders to build BitGo’s DeFi long-term roadmap
- Lead the team on the design and development of new services that integrate with different DeFi projects (DAOs, bridges, NFTs, DEXs, etc) for multiple blockchains
- Guide other internal teams integration efforts with the DeFi projects
- Manage team goals, project timelines, and delivery dates while ensuring proper allocation of resources and budgets within the team
- Lead and develop a team of talented and high-impact engineers, providing cultural, technical, and hands-on leadership
- Grow engineers by actively shaping a culture of open communication, craftsmanship, ownership, and accountability
- Be fully accountable to and drive accountability for KPIs pertaining to service health and uptime, software quality, and test coverage
- Drive a rigorous practice of thorough documentation and knowledge sharing
- Resolve escalations arising from operations and work with various teams to solve problems
- Align teams to broader company objectives and client expectations
jobAd.requirements:
- 7+ years of professional experience as a software engineer, 3+ years in a managerial role leading engineers
- Excellent understanding of the underlying technology for blockchains
- Proven ability to lead highly technical teams in an unknown space
- Experience with architectural patterns of large, high-volume applications
- Experience sourcing and hiring top engineering talent, including managerial talent
- Proven understanding of business goals and strategy and how that drives direction within an engineering department
- Proven ability to balance business requirements from various independent stakeholders with problems that impede work execution and delivery, while driving the highest ROI initiatives
- Strong working knowledge of modern software development methodologies, software design patterns, and SDLC
- A self-starter capable of adapting quickly and being decisive
- Engineering degree in Computer Science or equivalent
- Effective written and verbal communication skills
jobAd.preferred:
- Strong DeFi or trading knowledge
- Active contributor and thought leader in the Blockchain community
- Ability to translate a complex arrangement of software components into a cohesive architecture that yields clean, efficient, and highly maintainable code
- Shipped multiple projects and services to large scale consumers
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment

jobAd.title: Software Engineer (Backend), Blockchain Integration Team
jobAd.description:
BitGo is looking for a **Software Engineer** to join our blockchain integration team and help us build
a robust and scalable system to integrate new and existing blockchains .

jobAd.title: Senior Software Engineer, Javascript SDK
jobAd.description:
BitGo is looking for a **Senior Software Engineer** to join the SDK team within the Blockchain Unit to help us build our next generation of SDKs, 
new features and applications for our enterprise clients.
BitGo processes a significant amount of cryptocurrency transactions so our applications need to be fast, accurate, scalable, and secure.

Our integrated platforms interact with a number of exchanges, agencies, and governments around the world,
and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Build strong, resilient, and modular open-source and internal libraries to power our blockchain services: hot and cold wallets, indexing, staking, and broadcasting services among others
- Own the core SDK functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility from inception to deployment and customer integration
- Expose and document functionality to the open-source dev community
- Collaborate closely with all engineering teams and the open-source community to ensure consistency in understanding technical requirements
- Take direct responsibility for the quality, the release process, and distribution of the SDK
- Provide mentorship to your peers in the broader engineering team through code reviews and education on best practices
jobAd.requirements:
- At least 5 years of experience developing SDKs, libraries, or backend development
- Strong experience with JavaScript and/or Typescript in both browser and NodeJS runtimes
- Knowledge of best practices around monorepo packages
- Experience in Git/GitHub and branching methodologies, code review tools, CI tools, JIRA, Confluence, etc.
- Great with unit and functional testing and debugging
- Bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied mathematics, or another technical discipline from a top university
- Great at algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
jobAd.preferred:
- Experience in microservices architecture
- Strong experience with the NPM release process and semantic versioning
- Experience with RESTful API design
- Familiarity with Docker
- Understanding and strong interest in cryptocurrencies and the blockchain industry
- Understanding and experience working in the financial industry
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment

jobAd.title: Software Engineer, ETH
jobAd.description:
Long story short: Know anyone based out of the US/Canada with 2 years of experience with backend engineering, Node.js, and an interest/ or experience in Ethereum? We'd love to talk to them! 

//

BitGo is the leader in digital asset financial services, providing institutional investors with custody liquidity, and security solutions. Active in both centralized and decentralized finance, BitGo offers market leading trading, lending, and borrowing services through its prime brokerage services and acts as the custodian for WBTC, with more than $10 billion in custody and circulation. 

In 2020, BitGo launched BitGo Portfolio and Tax, providing clients with a full-stack solution for digital assets. In 2018, it launched BitGo Trust Company, the first qualified custodian purpose-built for storing digital assets. BitGo processes approximately 20% of all global Bitcoin transactions and supports over 400 coins and tokens.

BitGo’s customer base includes the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges and institutional investors and spans more than 50 countries. BitGo is backed by Goldman Sachs, Craft Ventures, Digital Currency Group, DRW, Galaxy Digital Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, and Valor Equity Partners.

BitGo is looking for a **Software Engineer** who will join our Ethereum team. This role can be worked remotely so long as your home base is in North America.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Pioneer the onboarding of new Ethereum-based tokens, protocols (L2, Bridges, Roll-ups), and network upgrades (Hard forks, Ethereum 2.0)
- Contribute to stability and scalability of Bitgo’s Ethereum infrastructure and transaction processing services

jobAd.title: Engineering Team Lead, Blockchain Integration
jobAd.description:
BitGo is looking for a **Senior Software Engineer (Team Lead)** to join our blockchain integration team and help us build
a robust and scalable system to integrate new and existing blockchains .
This role can be worked remotely so long as your home base is in North America.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Design and build scalable, well abstracted, and robust APIs, libraries, and services to integration blockchains into our custody platforms. 
- Own functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility from research, implementation to deployment.
- Build integration libraries and SDKs to interface with our server and APIs
- Expose and document functionality to the UI, third-party developers, and our internal and external tooling
- Collaborate closely with all engineering teams and product managers to ensure consistency in understanding of technical requirements and overall work quality
- Provide mentorship to your peers in the broader engineering team through code reviews and education on best practices
- Lead product development cycle, manage team resources and milestones. 
- Follow or champion for development practices that reinforces ownership, craftsmanship and growth
jobAd.requirements:
- At least 5 years of back-end, server-side software development
- Strong experience with TypeScript/Node.JS
- Great with unit and functional testing and debugging
- Great at providing simple and extensible abstractions to complex systems.
- Experience in Git/GitHub and branching methodologies, code review tools, CI tools, etc.
- Bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied mathematics, or another technical discipline from a top university
- Understanding of and strong interest in cryptocurrencies and blockchain
- Great at algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
- Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
- Previous experience in leading or managing an engineering team
jobAd.preferred:
- Understanding of and experience working in the blockchain industry
- Understanding of and experience working in the security industry 
- Experience with microservices and service-oriented architectures
- Ability to work full-stack and familiarity with React and Databases (MongoDB)
- Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment

jobAd.title: Senior Frontend Engineer, Blockchain Team
jobAd.description:
We are searching for a **Senior Frontend Engineer** to work in the Blockchain unit along with our Bitcoin, Ethereum, DeFi, Blockchain OS, and Staking teams. 
As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will help the teams develop the UI and UX for entirely new projects and maintain the current ones.

We are looking for teammates who share and practice our values: open communication, transparency, taking ownership, 
and a high level of craftsmanship. We are looking for coworkers who share our vision and mission: deliver trust in digital assets.
jobAd.responsibilities:
- Work closely with different blockchain experts to improve our UI functionality on a variety of projects for multiple coins
- Collaborate closely with different blockchain experts and product managers to plan and develop entirely new UIs for upcoming projects
- Develop features with clean, maintainable, and reusable code
- Improve existing user experiences
- Cross-team communications with stakeholders to understand implementation requirements and limitations
- Provide mentorship to your peers in the broader engineering team through code reviews and education on best practices
- Provide maintenance support and enhance performance to existing applications
jobAd.requirements:
- At least 5 years of frontend software development
- Strong experience with React
- Advanced knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, and HTML
- Experience working with modern JavaScript frameworks
- Experience working with Node.js and Express applications
- Experience working with design systems
- Experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end testing
- Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
jobAd.preferred:
- A portfolio showcasing past work
- Understanding of and strong interest in cryptocurrencies and blockchain
- Experience with blockchain in a work environment (e.g. previous internship/job at a cryptocurrency company)
- Experience working with GraphQL/Apollo Client
- Formik
jobAd.benefits:
- Competitive base salary, bonus and stock options
- 100% company paid health insurance for employee, partner and dependents
- Up to 4% 401k company match
- Paid parental leave, Paid vacation
- Free commuter/parking pass; 5 min from Caltrain
- Free custom lunches, dinners and snacks 
- Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs
- Great colleagues and inspiring startup environment
